items.heading: Frameworks
items.description: React, MaterialUI, Node, Spring, Material, Serenity, Selenium, Handlebars

items.heading: Concepts/Practices
items.description: Continuous Integration/Development, Agile, RESTful Webservices, SCM, Test/Behavior Driven Development, Full Stack Development

timeline.heading: Took AP Computer Science in High School
timeline.description: I knew next to nothing about computers in general until I decided to take a keyboarding course in HS. From there on, I took CS1, then CS 2 (AP), and even participated in competitions.

timeline.heading: Bachelors in CS at University of Texas at Dallas
timeline.description: Enrolled in the CS program at UTD after having received a scholarship for full tuition.

timeline.heading: Starting Working at State Farm
timeline.description: Started work as a backend developer building web services. Outside of work, I worked on my own projects, which were more UI-involved.

projects.heading: Projects that I've worked on
projects.sub-heading: Click on an item for details!

items.title: Portfolio Website
items.description: A modern portfolio website to showcase my work.
items.summary: Built using Bootstrap with ExpressJs backend. Server-side rendering with Handlebar templates. Hosted using Elastic Beanstalk.

items.title: Public API Browser
items.description: Single page application created with React and Bootstrap.

items.title: Reddit Bot that Sends Alerts
items.description: A script that monitors certain subreddits for posts that fulfill certain criterias and messages registered users.
items.summary: Uses OAuth and Reddit account to fetch information about subreddits, posts, and to message users.

items.title: Full Stack Secured Web App POC
items.summary: Created docker images for each slice of the web application (e.g. server, frontend, cache layer, database, reverse-proxy.

items.title: Command Line Tool for Performing Various Functions
items.description: Written with Python3 and Click framework.
items.summary: Allows for performing various tasks for user.
